Dear Mr. Lheureux:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to
the violations identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
 How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
 Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
 Specific time frames for each violation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
 How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
 The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.
FOR CWL ONLY
Please note that violations of any licensing rules are also violations of the MISEP and
your contract.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone

ALLEGATION:
Facility provided youth with a vaccine without consent of parent or DHHS. Facility
has a form which indicates youth was not approved for the vaccine.
The allegation in full reads as follows:
INVESTIGATION:
DCWL received the following complaint, “I signed a consent form stating that I do not
consent to Youth A receiving the COVID vaccine. I had spoke with his mother about
it and she did not want him to receive it. I noted that on the form they sent over and I
noted it in the email when I returned the form to Staff 2. I sent an email back stating
that Youth A had received his first does of the Pfizer vaccine. I returned the consent
form on 04/14/2021 at 11:32a. I received an email on 04/27/2021 at 3:25p stating he
had received the vaccine”.
I interviewed the Complainant by phone on 4/28/21. She restated the allegations
and reported she will provide a copy of the emails that outline the communication
between herself and the facility. She also reported Youth A received his vaccine
yesterday and she is planning on visiting him today to find out if he has side effects.
235 SOUTH GRAND AVENUE  PO BOX 30037
 LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909

I interviewed Administrator 1 by phone on 4/28/21. He reported being aware of
the allegations and that the facility “screwed up” by not following their
policy/procedures after speaking with Staff 1. He also reported he will provide a copy
of the facility policy/procedures on this issue.
Documents Reviewed:
I reviewed the document tilted “Wedgwood Christian Services Consent for Covid-19
Vaccine”. This document had Youth A’s name and birth date identified and it is
signed by his Foster Care Worker on 4/14/21. The do not consent to having this
vaccine administered is checked.
I reviewed the document titled “Medical Consent Agreement”. This document states,
“I understand Wedgwood will attempt to inform me prior to providing any and all
such services unless it is an emergency.”
I reviewed the document titled “FC-PMOU procedure for DHHS clients”. This
document states, “we may start the medication the same day we obtain the
witnessed verbal consent.”
I reviewed the stream of emails between the Foster Care Worker and the facility in
regards to the vaccine. The facility sent the consent form to the Foster Care Worker
on 4/10/21 asking her to sign the form for Youth A. The Foster Care Worker returned
the signed form on 4/14/21 and stated within the email “Here you are. Youth A’s
mother does not want him to get the vaccine hence the checked box. On 4/27/21 the
facility sent the Foster Care Worker an email stating, “Youth A was given his
1st Pfizer COVID-19 Vaccine today – 4/27/21. Please see enclosed Vaccine Fact
Sheet.” The Foster Care Worker replied on 4/27/21 with the following, “Youth A was
not supposed to receive the vaccine. While I was told I had to sign the consent form,
I spoke with his mother prior and she did not want him to receive it, which I noted. I
have attached the form that I previously sent in.” The facility responded on 4/28/21
“I am forwarding your email to the nurse who received this from you. I will have her
get back to you.”
APPLICABLE RULE
R 400.4142 Health services; policies and procedures.
(1) An institution shall establish and follow written health
service policies and procedures addressing all of the
following:
(a) Routine and emergency medical, and dental, and
behavioral health care.
(e) Dispensing medication.

ANALYSIS: The facility is found in non-compliance as they administered the
COVID vaccine without consent.
CONCLUSION: REPEAT VIOLATION ESTABLISHED
SI2019C0128013 dated 7/26/2019, CAP approval dated 7/31/2019.
III. RECOMMENDATION
With an acceptable corrective action plan, it is recommended that no change be
made to the license of this child caring institution.
